Review Text: Elderly company I was in became confused at drinks ordered and price charged for. Manager without question refunded amount queried. When clarified no overcharge was made. Manager was courteous and polite making refund a gift

It's a spoons. Adjust your expectations if getting food, but it is still good given the price. A reasonable place for an afternoon drink, even with small children or elderly relatives.
Not been on an evening, but doesn't seem to be a drunken lout pub like some city centre ones. More inviting than some of the other pubs locally in shaw
Nice and friendly place. I had the pleasure of being served by leah, she was polite, chatty, calm and very efficient even when the bar was extremely busy. Other girls on the bar seemed nice as well!

I wanted my eggs poached not hard boiled. No wonder it took you over half a hour to do my breakfast! Whilst I appreciate it was busy when i was in, pretty much everyone was already eating. The staff had to be asked twice where the food was, it came out lukewarm (its been sat somewhere for some time then) and your staff were rude when asked for the 2nd time over half a hour after ordering!

We went for tea last night and it was steak night , we both ordered medium and they both came out burnt yes burnt, sent them back and they came back not much better but at least they were warm unlike the rest ofc the dish the chips, peas and onion rings all came back cold.
Having eating at Shay Wake numerous times and never had food as bad as this I‚Äôm wondering if its been a change of kitchen team as they need to bring the old team back looking around at other tables they was a lot of food left on other plates as well.
On the plus side the manager was really good and offered us a free drink and refunded us back the price of our meal.

An above average Spoons..the only Real Ale in the town centre..
A Great sheltered outside area is a sun trap..

Food was mediocre at best. They state non alcoholic drinks, however 0.05% is still technically alcoholic and so was left with disappointment of a choice of over priced soft drinks or disgusting alcohol free Stella, and who wants to drink that waste water... Tables are sticky and staff look tired and fed up. The building itself was nice, could do with a touch up here and there but overall, I don't think I would go back. Didn't really want to be at a weatherspoons however it was a friends birthday choice, not mine.

Totally different to up steps in oldham. Shay wake is the exact opposite to up steps. The food is served quickly and hot. The staff are pleasant and polite they are very helpfull and friendly. And the customers are not screaming and shouting. I highly recommend this pub. It has a big outside area I noticed lots of children in summer with their parents. The tables inside are very quickly cleaned of plates and glasses unlike upsteps you have to empty a table yourself before seating and I used baby wipes to clean it often. I'm so pleased i found shay wake

Lovely atmosphere good food and affordable drinks and food . Definitely recommend.
Lynn and Dawn
Car park tight for parking
Market is only a minute away plenty of parking

Came for a late breakfast.  On the whole the food was plentiful and good. I would have liked a few mushrooms instead of just one. The vegetarian sausages were really nice. Our son had the American breakfast and there was a lot of it and he ate everything! My only complaint is that, apart from my sausages which were hot, everything else was lukewarm but the plate was cold so that wouldn't have helped. All in all very good and good value for money. Plenty of menu choices and staff are pleasant and friendly. We will visit again sometime for a meal later in the day.
Food was great! Served by Sophie, an absolute pleasure quick service and very friendly and polite

Called in for a lemonade, during the afternoon. It looked alot different than other spoons pubs, like a dining hall...full of people having lunch, every table occupied so the food must be good, good clean pub
Overall good service clean and friendly atmosphere food was very good and decent variety quite busy but didn't wait long for food which was great

You know what you get. Cheap and cheerful food. Friendly staff, quick service.

Nice looking pub.
had really nice food and really nice service, leah especially was great with us!
Leah was very friendly.  Welcoming staff great food like ok forward to visiting again
Normally the atmosphere in here is a bit dull but with the wonderful service I got from Leah i might come more often.
Spoons is the same everywhere reasonable food and cheap drinks there's not much atmosphere when your having breakfast but at night the place is packed and you bring the atmosphere
Recommended Dishes: English Breakfast, Large Mixed Grill, American Breakfast

Review Text: Can't rate the food as I didn't eat here. If I'm honest it's not my kind of place but friends like it.

Came here today really nice spoons with a little beer garden which is always a winner. Staff and service was good food was OK thought it was still 50% off but its not just some items which is abit misleading. The gents was swimming in piss
Local for great food at great value. Clean and a comfortable place to chill eat and drink. Always busy and child friendly. Massive beer garden to rear.
As with all the only wetherspoons I know where the toilets aren't a 3 mile hike
19 of march and the so called manager attitude absolutely stinks. looks like he coked up sweating his back out at a cool bar and then the food that was served even more shocking
OK, food always good  and quick. But  I had to order from the bar   ordering from app wasn't available at the time
Recommended Dishes: Steak Chips and Miss, BBQ Chicken, Large Mixed Grill

Review Text: Busy Spoons with a lovely atmosphere, helpful staff and good selection of reasonably priced real ales.
A fabulous Wetherspoon with a very pleasant atmosphere, reflecting the seemingly very local clientele. Another very welcome find on the usual and  extensive travels around the UK

Has a great experience, the food was great, the drink was nice, the service from Finley was impeccable, he provided us with the best customer service of any wetherspoons around the country, we have worked away for many of years
Gorgeous full English Breakfast. Food nice and warm.
Good food and a good atmosphere, the staff are very polite and friendly.

Had fab meal good portions size
Good food üëç
Food not cooked properly, been to other Wetherspoons where the food was cooked a lot better I will never be going to the Wetherspoons in shaw again
Nice coffee. Pay once and get unlimited refills
Just love the brekky here. Excellent service considering the place is usually very busy.

Had a Christmas lunch here this week. It was disgusting... Very poor quality.
What can only be described as; "Cheap sandwich turkey circles"üòê and school type yacky Mash with a rock hard ball of dried up stuffing. The only decent bit was the teeny tiny baby carrots, unfortunately there was only 2 of them.
Very disappointed.
I've been here several times and it's always been decent for the money... You get what you pay for, I get that. But won't be returning.
Really enjoy going here for breakfast and a couple of cheeky onese with my partner

Probably one of the nicest wetherspoons we've been in. If we have a meal, it's now always at this one. Went Tues 24 Jan. Got there about 12.30. it was packed. Only one table left for three. But despite that, wasn't a long wait for our food, and it was hot. All three of us enjoyed what we had.
Food excellent service a little slow but over all good
Best place on the planet. 10 out of 10. üòÅ

Chris is an outstanding manager, his level of professionalism is definitely shown through his customer service skills. Sorted everything out for me when I wasn't too impressed with something and went above an beyond to meet my expectation !! This guy needs a raise!

Cheers shaywake n Chris manager üíØüí™üí™üí™
Food was really tasty, service excellent. Unfortunately the place stinks (carpets - mix of booze and damp).
Really good atmosphere, food is absolutely bang on for the price and beer is mega cheap, can't fault it to be honest

The food was nice and hot and quite tasty, so a great value for money. We spent a good couple of hours here with the drinks flowing without breaking the bank so a great value for money. The man collecting the glasses was very diligent and they never built up often, so great work.
Popped in while around the area.. gotta say drinks and food came out rapidly!! And was all beautifully cooked very much enjoyed üòâ  staff are lovely and atmosphere was great üëç well done üëè ‚Ä¶
Busy place, popular with locals. Triple burger was massively disappointing........
Great place .quite small not always room
Great selection of food and drink at good prices
Food good, great service, clean toilets and pub the cleaners must be fab there
Busy pub in the centre of Shaw. Pint was cheap and standard quality. The pizza was well cooked and tasted very nice.

I ordered 2 white wine spritzer‚Äôs, one with ice. I saw that the bar person had charged for lemonade. When I said a spritzer was with soda water she challenged me but gave me 2 wines with soda & both with ice. When I said I‚Äôd asked for one with ice she gave me such a dirty look! Think she needs to brush up on her customer relations skills.
Arrogant and extremely rude manager me n friends spent over 200 quid on Saturday night in there  but manager disrespectful
Food was poor. Warm at best !
Good restaurant an pub busy food an price very good
Great place! And as an employee I couldn't be happier to work at such a place!
Recommended Dishes: English Breakfast, Naan Bread to a Garlic Naan, Meat Feast Pizza, Chicken Wings, Scampi and Chips, Pizza, Two Grilled Tomato Halves, Traditional Breakfast, Large Mixed Grill, American Breakfast, Fish and Chips

Review Text: Food cold(breakfast) and poor quality Witherspoon's going Dow the nick.
Always good, cheap drinks, nice food and jolly staff.   Always busy though and sometimes hard to get a table.
Tonight was four star not too busy  Under ¬£7 for a large pino and a pint of San Miguel
It is a decent 'spoons. Staff are always friendly.
Great hot food served up at a reasonable waiting time. Neil looked after us really well. Great atmosphere.
the bald army plus one loved it,,nice pub,nice beer garden and great service

Had a breakfast meeting here.
Usual Wethepoons with no music, making talking easy.
Friendly staff, good value, tasty food and nice surroundings.
Great for a daytime drop in
Great food good atmosphere reasonably priced clean and staff very attentive and professional small beer garden to the rear parking behind the pub

Never been served food or drinks so quickly in my whole life ! Great value , ordered from my table. Yummy breakfast brunch and will definitely be making it a regular visit. Clean, tidy , busy, tasty and fast. Thankyou
Had a breakfast was cold and took 20mins to get a coffee not worth the money
Had a breakfast here and was pleasantly surprised really decent,staff good üëç ‚Ä¶

For the price, the food is excellent.
The people are nice too.

Nice atmosphere but much too noisy at times. Locally known as the turkey farm. Food is recently good but depends on chef. Toilets are a massive problem, it's Always difficult to find a clean one as flushing system is totally ineffective. If you happen to find the shay wake quiet and  with a decent chef and cleaned, well flushing toilets it can be a superb venue for family, friends or couples. The bar staff are always amazing.
Always nice food, staff really helpful, and hardworking, nothing too much trouble, great prices too!

Peacefull little weaterspoons, generally go here after swimming/gym.
Good staff. Food good.
Although scrambled egg today can't of been from 3 eggs as menu states, rather 1 egg of a terepin maybe.

Been around a few years but that was the worst steak ever, I even paid the extra for the gourmet, I wouldn‚Äôt give it my Labrador, been going in since it opened, nobody asked if it was ok the downward spiral continues for Tim, get a grip mate

Love to eat here it is a very busy place so go early. Food is great staff are very polite and friendly, it's very clean, and has a small beer garden. The beer garden is closed at 8pm and smokers must go out on the street at the front of the building. This pub has a great atmosphere even though they do not have music on. You will be very surprised by how loud it can get in this pub. I recommend that you visit here.

Well if it was me I would give no stars, we went to get some breakfast and when my partner asked when is it opening he never got told what time and the lady could not tell us. Wasn't sure how long to wait so gone to cafe instead.

My local of choice, cheap obviously, its a spoons. Staff are always really nice, few of them recognise me now, not sure if thats a good thing. Foods fine, its not gourmet, again, its a spoons. Best, easiest place for pres other than a house party really.
Always good food, reasonably priced...definitely better than the Rochdale branch which is a lit nearer

I'm so glad we have this place in Shaw. Decent food and drink, good service and nice standard of cleanliness. I will continue to regularly visit with family and friends. Definitely recommend great value for money.
Wanted coffee, was just given an empty cup. No explanation that there was a self serve coffee machine. Poor service

Place is good a friendly atmosphere,  staff good until when getting a coffee 2 members of staff used their teeth to open the coffee bean packs. Not good at all, hope this practice is not the norm. Hygiene out the window
A great place for food and a quick pint but VERY busy. The last few times, I've been unable to get a table so ended up going elsewhere.

This place isn't too bad but it's really let down by the incredibly rude male member of staff. He's a skinny guy with tattos up his arms. I was in on Tuesday 5th April at 18:38.
He's incredibly rude and clearly is on some sort of power trip

Great place for a casual drink and cheap and cheerful menu, don't know how they do it for the price. My friend and I went for lunch and had a baguette and chips and latte each for under ¬£9 for both of us... the latte was unlimited so had a free refill as well. It was quite busy but didn't wait long to be served.

Food was avergage but the customer device more than made up for it. Atmosphere was good although could do with some music. Asked for steak medium rare however it was very rare when it came, I didn't complain until the lady working there checked on us and took it away for me to be recooked straight away with no problems, she then also checked on us when I started eating it again. My friend who was with me had a steak that was very tough and when he said this to the lady she said there wasn't much she could do but still referred it to a manager, who came over and offered to swap it for something else and refund the difference which was very kind. They even boxed it up for us on request which was extremely helpful as we had to leave soon. Would definitely go back soon.
I tend to go in on an afternoon after a walk. Always a good crowd in there and I can easily find a spare seat. Good value prices too. I'm not food guy, but everyone else around is ordering.
I love my Spoons and this is no exception to great price, good food and friendly service.
No stop at home microwave  your own meals

This used to be a lovely place to eat out, but it has gone downhill based on this last visit...filthy tables and more food stuck to the floor than on the plates. I am used to the rough and ready nature of Witherspoon's but this was a different - and lower - level. Won't be going back.

Good outdoor seating area and great service from the staff throughout, making sure your looked after, following the rules and keeping everything in order. Macauley made sure our table was well looked after and allowed us to enjoy our post lockdown evening out.
Nice pub, not enough space to sit, service is spot on, food quality could be better

I have frequented this establishment for a few years now and the food has been excellent most of the time. The only complaint being a steak they did not trim the  fat off. The atmosphere is warm and friendly, and the staff always have a welcoming smile for you when you arrive and throughout a most enjoyable evening.
Popular pub, used table service  app. Food and drink were quickly served-food good and hot, beer cold, pleasant staff. All in all a pleasant lunch/experience. Happy to re visit.
Always a nice experience in here. Great value, good food and cheerfull staff.

Usual weatherspoons fare.  Not home cooked, but you know what you are getting.  Nice clean pub with fairly cheap drinks. Very busy at weekends.  Wish it were a bit bigger as it is very popular.  Bar staff are good, and even when busy service is fine.
Decent beer at a great price. Food basic but great service and at a very reasonable price. Parking near by. Definitely worth a visit.
Good location . Central position to buses and tram services .  Efficient and friendly staff. Good value for money. Busy pub usual Wetherspoon deals and offers. It's worth giving it a try.
Great place great food speedy quick friendly service *****
Good atmosphere, great food reasonable prices.

It's a wetherspoons you get what you pay for
Friendly staff good breakfasts but the eggs were rubbish and the cutting of the toast was at best woeful

Regretting taking my coat off somewhat it's not right warm in a morning

This is probably one of the smallest Weatherspoons I've been too. Still enough seating but just felt a little small inside.

Service was still brilliant as usual with good Weatherspoons food.

The restaurant/Pub was absolutely FULL meals being served as large groups going to Grand National.
Service was quick and pleasant by VERY HARD WORKING staff, well done and thank you üëè ‚Ä¶
You just can't go wrong in these venues
Fantastic service, delicious and fresh dishes
Expensive. Food has no taste at all! They don't know how to cook a meal.

I ordered a small portion of fish and chips. There is small and then there's really small.

I complained, but nothing was done. The manager said " This was half of the normal size of the fish and chips" .

I now that wetherspoons are supposed to be value for money, but I didn't feel like I got any value at all. Very disappointed.

Food was ok, typical weatherspoons ready meal type food.  Don‚Äôt try to get 1/2 rice / 1/2 chips as rice is in pre portioned bags.  But hey ho, you get what you pay for.  They brought me incorrect meal but the bar man was so rude when I said that wasn‚Äôt what I ordered.  He basically called me a liar.  However my biggest disappointment the overcrowding of the tables, with only probably 30cm between them. There are a selection of booths running down the centre of the room which had very large tables in them but with only 2 or 3 people sat at them.  A total waste of space.   You couldn‚Äôt have a private conversation.  If you put a bag on the floor it will get kicked, trodden on as was mine.

Its a small spoons orientated for dinning with lots of booths. Astoundingly quick breakfast delivery and but cold too.
Good service and not expensive but is smaller than in the past so not best  priced
Nice and clean, staff are friendly and good prices. Overall good experience in shay wake nice portions and very well priced food and drink. I would definitely recommend.

Nice modern place doesn't have the history or charm like other wetherspoons but in an ideal location easy to get to with free parking at the rear. Three of us ate here today and the food was great apart from my chicken burger the chicken was dry and hard hopefully a one off
Beer was lovely as always I will be back!

I thought that this was the better of the two Wetherspoons in Oldham. Friendlier service than the town centre one and a good crowd with a mix of clientele.
An original feature fireplace as soon as you walk in. TV screen showing the latest news
Not sure if the place shows sports

Nice pub, kinda local but was completely comfortable here. Food was excellent, and the prices good. Longer than usual wait at the bar, but that was more to do with the fact that only one person was serving. Enjoyable visit.
Good place to have a few drinks & food. Staff are good and its a good atmosphere

Visited Saturday afternoon with a family member. Always a good atmosphere, was quite packed with a good mix of people. Typical range of beers you would find in a Wetherspoons outlet. Bar service good considering volume of customers

DREADFUL! decided to go for some breakfast with my mum as lock down restrictions have been relaxed. We were sat not far from the kitchen and what i saw was disgraceful. My mum ordered a small English breakfast and i ordered a large English breakfast. As the kitchen door was open i looked to see if my breakfast was coming, when i saw one of the chefs grab an egg off a hot plate with his bare hands, no gloves or nothing, he did this multiple times. when my breakfast came out i said to the waitress should the chef be picking fried eggs up with his bare hands? to which she responded "they use hand sanitiser in between" which as a customer tells me they see this as a normal way of plating food, might have to buy them a spatula or some tongues. This put me off my eggs so i decided to leave them and eat everything else, all the other items were cold and the hash browns tasted of pure oil. wont be visiting here again as i dont like my food being grabbed by peoples bare hands. Also with the current covid 19 pandemic shouldn't they be taking extra precautions when handling food.

Nice atmosphere
Food nice pleasant staff

Went for breakfast, had the large need the energy to push me through the week, didnt have to wait long ,cooked perfect and a great price. Staff are really friendly and polite would highly recommend and I will be visiting again üëç ‚Ä¶

Moderate food for moderate price. Very loud. A drink with whiskey and cola would have like a glass in which someone drunk a whiskey before you (if it was a girl, you'll notice lipstick over the glass) and plenty of cola, don't expect good quality alcohol.
Called in for breakfast, good value and excellent service.
We are regular visitors to Wetherspoon pubs, and this one in particular, and the last time we visited it was just not good, however it seems to have vastly improved üòä ‚Ä¶

AleaAl liked this place.however when my mother was there last week she was not treated very well by the new manager.she ordered a meal and realised she hadn't got a free drink with it.when she went back to the bar and asked for the drink the manager's reply was "well you never asked for it". surely she . should have politely asked my mother what she would like to drink.my mother is 80 and wasn't happy with this woman's attitude.courtesy costs nothing .

The service from the bar staff left a lot to be desired, one young man working hard while three female staff were busily avoiding the clientele. Not happy. Tables left with dirty plates, another young man who was trying to serve food and collect used pots at the same time, although very pleasant, he was unable to keep up with the service.
Asked for a rare steak, I got a medium steak. Oh well you het what you pay for. One quarm for the waiting on staff " tie your hair up" even the male staff, looks horrendous when serving food
Friendly staff, it's a busy place and it's still quite clean with loads of places to sit, table service is a godsend

This has to be the strangest Wetherspoons I‚Äôve ever set foot in.
I‚Äôm from Brighouse and I thought The Richard Oastler was odd but wow!

Absolutely everybody is inbred without a doubt.

I love to people watch and listen in on people conversations.

David, Mike and Warren- you need to stop that! Your parents would not be proud and it‚Äôs not a clever thing to be doing.

Jonny, Darren, Louise and Claire- grow up!

Tony and Barbara- you to need to realise how old you and keep your opinions to yourself as your both awful people.

Dan and Jess- nobody cares! Absolutely nobody cares. Get a new job that would be my suggestion.

I could go on! We are actually going to come back just to ear wig on the total freaks that reside here.

My visit today wasn't very good. I had the Gammon and egg, that was good. My wife had  fish and chips, the fish was really a big lump of Batter, very tiny bit of Fish .We had one just the same in the Banbury last October. My wife's sister had the Scampi and that was fine.
My favourite one in Manchester area go everytime we play Oldham or Rochdale away easy of metrolink and always food arrives within 10-15 min
As wetherspoons go this is definitely one of the more welcoming ones I have visited, they provide comfortable booth's an open fire and friendly staff with the food maintaining wetherspoons standards.

Great beer in a decent atmosphere. Just could do with being 1/3 bigger as tables are very close together as someone with an over the top personality and laugh on a nearby table can get a bit annoying after a while with nowhere to escape to.
Staff were super lovely and friendly food was good as well

Absolute garbage. Food was somehow on my table before I managed to walk back from the bar. How is that possible? Everything was stone cold. Coffee machine wasn't filled. Maxhine coffee just doesn't taste as good as the old filtered stuff. Dreadful just aboid
Very good food and drink, great place ti meet up with friends and family

The food is consistently poorly done. Hard rock nan bread today with luke warm chicken jalfrezi. Otherwise it's fine place to have a drink with atmosphere. Upsteps always better for food than here even though it's same menu practically. Just better cooked it seems in U.psteps

The breakfasts were a joke again when we visited. Served on cold plates when specifically asked for "hot", bacon as thin as paper, over cooked eggs, not a foody place obviously depends on the cook working. As a drinking place nice cheep drinks but sounds like a  turkey farm, pity all the loud talking can't be split up. Up to you.
Great little pub, tasty food, fast, friendly table service and good prices what more can you ask for?
Brilliant food. Fantastic beer selection. All at a very reasonable price. Professional, friendly & accommodating staff. A clean & cosy establishment all make for a welcoming atmosphere.

Called last night 3/9/21 with a friend who suffered a head injury some years ago. Doormen refused my friend entry claiming he'd had too much to drink. We explained the situation but to no avail. Doormen claimed bar staff would not be happy if they let us in. Disappointing but predictable attitude in this day and age.
I love being able to use the app to order food & drinks.  No pushing at the bar, the hardest thing is finding a table as it's always busy.

Asked to turn the air con down as it was blowing a gale noting to do with temperature it was just blowing loudly to which the reply was ‚Äòno we have just turned it up‚Äô then the food came at breakfast and all of the items were stone cold and some items listed on the menu were missing from the plates very poor and wouldn‚Äôt recommend to anyone it also says a lot that I‚Äôm writing a review given I‚Äôve never reviewed anywhere before this is a big warning I‚Äôd stay clear of this place better places to eat around Shaw
Always good atmosphere & good food. Try the Aberdeen Angus steak, had plenty of those. Very tasty & reasonably priced. It's a little cheaper on their steak nights.

Called in for a bite, specifically asked for normal pepsi, they gave me diet (I have a reaction to the sweetener). Was replaced without fuss after I'd already drank some üôÑ. Food and service was ok and amazingly for a wetherspoons the toilets aren't up 15 flights of stairs! They are on the same floor! ‚Ä¶

Went for breakfast on Saturday 9th Jan with my son.. Absolutely gorgeous, and the coffee with free refills is quality. Two big breakfasts with coffee cost us ¬£10,45p. You couldn't buy and make it any cheaper at home. And it came within 5 mins of ordering and was hot. Well done Shay wake. Will deffo  be back again.
Clean and tidy, staff were excellent a perfect evening. Well done to all the team for making our experience a happy one - we will be back soon

This place has gone downhill in the last few months. Breakfast now is always served with cheap, nasty sausages, rock hard eggs. Gross. Called in two weeks ago, ordered a burger. It was burnt, chips were cold. Disgusting ...you need to sack your useless chefs
Absolutely 5 star took my my stepdad and my sons dad. kitchen staff and bar staff were nothing but amazing. Covid  restrictions  in place very well organised Thank you we will he back üòÄ ‚Ä¶
The staff here are so helpful and hardworking especially Neil and Dan,I hope their bosses appreciate just how hard they work.They go that extra mile and it‚Äôs much appreciated
Busy place. Could possibly have an extra person on the bar but the wait wasn't too long. Curry Thursday was very tasty and well priced. Don't miss out. üëç ‚Ä¶
Good service;either on the app (brilliant) or human ordering system of old style! Food was mediocre - run out of fish on Friday at 3.30pm???? Great atmosphere. Overall worth 4.5 stars

The bar man or perhaps was the he manager ? was very friendly and helpful nothing too much trouble.
A very clean and comfortable establishment
Food and drink excellent value.

Friendly atmosphere, excellent bar staff and ridiculously low prices!
No ripping off the customer here!

Gone down hill this place ,kids running the place running around like headless chickens ,food was awful burger dry ,chips over cooked and dry was probably yesterday ,didn't have straws for kids to use with there drinks and only had carlsberg and Stella on draft has nobody been doing the orders there ,only positive was the young waitress cleared table quick and she was busy cleaning other tables all other staff were very unprofessional especially the lad who served me and got larger an black was just cheap blackcurrant put in not schnapps .

I love the business model that JD have for all their different locations which is unique.! But I'm sure an area inside could be created for ecig users..!! otherwise top marks for staff, food and drinks prices....
Great pub with great prices, the waiter was very polite üòä ‚Ä¶

A decent Wetherspoon experience, ease of ordering on the app and decent value food.
Quality of food and beer selection is good too.
Great atmosphere on a Friday and Saturday night and quick service. I love using the wetherspoon app so you can easily order and pay for food and drinks quickly without losing your seat.

We regularly visit here and are usually happy with it . Lately though , especially today it was dreadful . The food was awful . Our granddaughters burgers were near enough burnt . There was no tomato sauce for them either . The staff were run off their feet . Not enough of them . Wont be going again for a while .
Lovely Wetherspoons. Nice staff. Special shout out to Chloe for being a sick server

First visit to Shay Wake @ 9.00 on Sunday 04/03/18, it appears to be a nice clean environment,  we had breakfast that couldn't  be faulted. Pity that the the early morning p**s artists are in attendance.

2 full breakfasts .
Asked for extra bacon instead of hash browns on 1 . Ment have 2 eggs only got 1 no sausage no mushrooms
Then given a cup for my brew and that was full of lipstick.   Disgusting for the price wont go there for breakfast again.
Nice breakfast, waited for quite a while though. They were obviously very busy so  i complaints.
Love the booths, IF ya can get in one.  Place is nicely decorated, can get busy at weekends though because its cheap drinks n food. The food is nice enough for a Wetherspoons.

No I did not enjoy the pub I was in,I wanted to just have a drink of alcohol and relax,
But I felt unwelcome from the door staff although Tom and colleague was great but when I was bought a drink from a another patron at your establishment I was shocked by how I was treated for just standing up,
But please be assured that I will be advertising how bad your public house treats its customers

The only decent place for a meal in the town centre. True, it's only wetherspoons, but I like the consistency of the chain and the prices are excellent. Its clean and friendly and appropriate for families with children.
Got order on the app wrong again and made to show my emails receipt like I was lieing but otherwise ok
Really vibrant pub. Always seems to be busy and lively with a good choice of beverages.
We come here as a family on a regular basis. Pleasant and friendly atmosphere. Very busy on the Tuesday steak night, but still give good service.
Nice hot food and a warm welcome. Very cheap food and booze. I would definitely recommend.
Good food and drink at reasonable prices. It was very busy, with lots of groups of people enjoying themselves, but able to get served quickly.

Did a table service on the app, was brought the wrong drink a bottle of pale ale instead of a gin and tonic to be told in a rude manner by the manager that seen as the bottle was opened they wouldnt take it back, and then checked my PayPal this morning to see that they had actually taken the transaction twice!!! How cheeky!

Nice food however wasn‚Äôt worth the wait! Happens every time I come
